# ARSkeleton2D

**Class**

An object that describes the locations of a body’s joints in the camera feed.

## Declaration

```swift
class ARSkeleton2D
```

## Overview

[doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSkeleton2D] provides you with a 2D body’s joints in a flat hierarchy so you can access them efficiently. The joint locations are normalized within the range [0..1] in the coordinate space of the current frame’s camera image, where 0 is the upper left, and 1 is the bottom right.

To access a skeleton’s joints by name, you use [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSkeleton2D/landmarkForJointNamed:]. To access a named joint by index (for example, for performance reasons), you query the definition for the named joint index using [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSkeletonDefinition/index(for:)], then access [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSkeleton2D/jointLandmarks-12vkw] using the resulting index.

## Getting Joint Landmarks

- **jointLandmarks**: The joint landmarks in normalized coordinates.
- **landmark(for:)**: Returns the location of a joint with a given name.

## Body Data

- **Capturing Body Motion in 3D**: Track a person in the physical environment and visualize their motion by applying the same body movements to a virtual character.
- **ARBody2D**: The screen-space representation of a person ARKit recognizes in the camera feed.
- **ARSkeleton3D**: The skeleton of a human body that ARKit tracks in 3D space.
- **ARSkeleton**: The interface for the skeleton of a tracked body.
- **ARSkeletonDefinition**: The hierarchy of joints and their names.
